entry.title: Fire Season Officially Ends in Douglas County - 2025
entry.summary: DFPA officially ended the 2025 fire season on Oct. 10 at 9:01 a.m. after recent rain and cooler weather. Restrictions are lifted, but caution is urged when burning debris. Logging slash still requires a permit, and some private or public lands may maintain fire restrictions.

entry.title: Roseburg Man Faces Multiple Charges After Two-Day Crime Spree and Jail Outburst
entry.summary: Jeremy Brett Vroman, 48, faces multiple felony charges after allegedly committing two crimes in one day, including a daycare burglary and breaking a home’s window. He appeared via video from jail after refusing to attend his arraignment and has declined a court-appointed attorney.

entry.title: Students Walk Out at Roseburg High Over Locker Room Access Debate
entry.summary: Students at Roseburg High walked out Wednesday during eighth period to protest transgender students using locker rooms matching their gender identity. Counter-protesters also attended, calling the demonstration transphobic. Oregon law allows students to use facilities by gender identity.

entry.title: Heat Lamp Blamed for Dixonville House Fire; Kitten Rescued
entry.summary: Firefighters responded to a house fire Tuesday morning on Buckhorn Road in Dixonville. Flames were coming from several windows, and one kitten was rescued. The blaze started from a heat lamp used to warm baby chickens, officials said. No injuries were reported.

entry.title: [National News] Florida Man Arrested for Arson in Deadly Palisades Fire That Killed 12
entry.summary: A Florida man has been arrested for allegedly starting the blaze that became January’s deadly Palisades Fire in Los Angeles, which killed 12 and destroyed thousands of homes. Officials say 29-year-old Jonathan Rinderknecht first set a smaller fire that later reignited amid strong winds.

entry.title: RHS students and parents hold walkout over transgender rights

A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said at 1:40 p.m. a deputy responded to the incident in the 300 block of Grimes Drive in the Drain area. entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE JAIL WOMAN FOR REPORTED PRIOR THEFT INCIDENT
entry.summary: October 7, 2025 10:10 a.m. Roseburg Police jailed a woman for a reported prior theft incident on Monday. An RPD report said officers contacted 37-year-old Richelle Spearen during a security check at a business in the 2900 block of Northwest Edenbower Boulevard and learned she was a suspect in a past theft case. entry.title: TWO VEHICLES COLLIDE IN DOWNTOWN ROSEBURG MONDAY
entry.summary: October 7, 2025 9:50 a.m. Two vehicles collided in downtown Roseburg on Monday afternoon. A Roseburg Police report said at 3:00 p.m. a sedan was traveling eastbound on Southeast Oak Avenue approaching Southeast Stephens Street. The vehicle was in a “left turn only” lane but proceeded straight through the intersection. An SUV was traveling eastbound...

entry.title: THREE-VEHICLE COLLISION IN SUTHERLIN ON MONDAY
entry.summary: October 7, 2025 9:40 a.m. Three-vehicles were involved in a collision in Sutherlin on Monday. entry.title: DRIVER ALLEGEDLY FALLS ASLEEP, LEADING TO SINGLE-VEHICLE CRASH
entry.summary: October 7, 2025 9:20 a.m. A driver allegedly fell asleep, leading to a single-vehicle crash on Monday afternoon. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said at approximately 1:45 p.m. the 28-year-old man drove his van off the roadway in the 600 block of Willis Creek Road in Dillard area. entry.title: Agent Orange town hall seminar scheduled for Saturday
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Associates of Vietnam Veterans of America Chapter 805 in Roseburg will have an Agent Orange Town Hall this Saturday.

entry.title: Library to host disability rights speaker Oct. 16
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Roseburg Public Library invites the community to a virtual presentation by disability rights activist Jennifer Keelan-Chaffins at 6: p.m. Thursday, Oct. 16.

entry.title: Winston's Riverbend Live! receives $10,000 for Summer Youth Theater Camp

entry.title: Kuki-Shi mayor and delegates put down roots in Douglas County with tree planting ceremony
entry.summary: It's been a busy week for the delegates of Kuki-Shi, Japan. During their tour of the Roseburg area for the Roseburg Sister Cities exchange program, they've been given a taste of its artistry, industry and culture.

entry.title: Stewart Park Bridge is closed to pedestrians on Wednesday
entry.summary: The Stewart Park Bridge will be closed to all foot and bicycle traffic 6 a.m. until about 7 p.m. Wednesday as part of the roadway resurfacing of the rehabilitation project that has closed regular bridge traffic since February.

entry.title: ROSEBURG COULD SEE LAST 80 PLUS DEGREE DAY FOR THE SEASON ON TUESDAY
entry.summary: October 7, 2025 5:20 a.m. Roseburg could see the last 80 plus degree day for the season on Tuesday. The National Weather Service is calling for a change in conditions beginning on Wednesday, with high temperatures dropping to the 60s for the next week. The normal high temperature for this week in Roseburg is 72...

entry.title: DFPA PRESCRIBED BURNS CONTINUE THIS WEEK
entry.summary: October 7, 2025 3:50 a.m. With fire danger rated as low, the Douglas Forest Protective Association is continuing with prescribed burns around the Douglas District. entry.title: MONIQUE DESPAIN RAISES $155,000 IN FIRST 48 HOURS OF CAMPAIGN
entry.summary: October 7, 2025 3:40 a.m. On Monday, Oregon Fourth Congressional District candidate Monique DeSpain announced she has raised over $155,000 across all campaign entities in the first 48 hours after launching her bid to unseat incumbent Congresswoman Val Hoyle. entry.title: ROARING 20’S THEMED FUNDRAISING EVENT HAPPENING IN OCTOBER
